<escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_list/> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_plan>--Inform local IT of the necessary steps to change DHCP and static IP clients to use a different DC/DNS servers for name resolution --Use Network Monitor to check if any DNS queries are being received by the DC before demoting, reconfigure any requestors DNS before continuing --Notify the Operations Teams about the demotion via email --Place the DC in outage mode in monitoring tools --Run the AD DC Demotion Preparation tool in management tools --Logon to the DC to be removed from Active Directory--Run DCPROMO to uninstall AD and reboot --Uninstall DNS --Remove the server from the domain by joining it to a workgroup and reboot --Logon to a regional hub DC in the same domain as the DC that was removed --Delete the computer object --Delete any leftover DNS records --Locate the DNS zone for the domain and then right-click it and select properties --Click the name servers tab --Locate and delete the entry for the removed DNS server (if present) --Delete the server object in AD Sites and Services --Logon to a forest root DC --launch the DNS console on the forest root DC --locate and delete all DNS records that point to the removed DC in the _msdcs zone and in any child zones of it  --Also verify that no record exists in the delegated zone for the child domain zone --Create requests to remove device from anti-virus, endpoint management, monitoring and ServiceNow CMDB</implementation_plan> <justification/> <knowledge>false</knowledge>
